result.execSummary:
The defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.  
Pay all court costs and surcharges.  DOC to collect from 25% of prison accounts under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 13CF2150 revocation sentence.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lenard Mervin Daniel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (18 pages) commencing 06-24-2014 Sentencing received and filed.

Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21.
Victim Impact statement received and filed.  
Letters on behalf of defendant and certificates from House of Correction filed.
There is no request for restitution.
Defendant is currently serving a revocation sentence in 13CF2150.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 155 days time served, concurrent with 13CF2150 revocation sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 18  MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison accounts under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant remanded. 
Filed;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  The Court ordered the defendant REMANDED.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph T Domask in court, defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel not in court, in custody and not produced.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Case set for final pre-trial.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph T. Domask in court, defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense in constest posture at this time and requests jury trial.  Defense also requests possible plea date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in court with attorney Joseph T Domask.  Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in custody.  William Levins for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Lenard Mervin Daniel in custody.  Brittany C. Grayson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
